description: From Late Latin apodosis, from Ancient Greek ἀπόδοσις (apódosis), from ἀπό (apó, “back again”) and δόσις (dósis, “gift”).

entries.meaning: (logic, grammar) The consequential clause in a conditional sentence.
examples: In "I will be coming if this weather holds up", "I will be coming" is the apodosis and "this weather holds up" is the protasis.
